```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(here)
```

# Plots with ggplot2

We are going to make plots in R and it's going to be amazing.

```{r read-csv}
ca_np <- read.csv(here("data", "ca_np.csv"))
```

``` {r read-xls(x)}
ci_np <- read_excel(here("data", "ci_np.xlsx"))
```

```{r ggplots}
ggplot(data = ci_np, aes(x = year, y = visitors)) + geom_line()
```

```{r aes_var}
gg_base <- ggplot(data = ci_np, aes(x = year, y = visitors))
```

```{r point}
gg_base +
  geom_point()
```

``` {r col}
gg_base +
  geom_col()
```

```{r area}
gg_base +
  geom_area()
```

```{r custom line}
gg_base +
  geom_line(
    colour = "purple",
    linetype = "dashed"
  )
```

``` {r custom point}
gg_base +
  geom_point(colour = "purple",
             pch = 17,
             size = 4,
             alpha = 0.5)
```

``` {r custom element point}
gg_base +
  geom_point(
    aes(size = visitors,
        colour = visitors),
    alpha = 0.5
  )
```

```{r custom element col}
gg_base +
  geom_col(aes(fill = visitors))
```
